result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: prison sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions for extended supervision will be set by agent.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Martin Bruflodt

defendant.name: Bruflodt, Joel Martin
defendant.address: 100 Corrections Drive, Joel Bruflodt #650678, Stanley, WI 54768

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Partial. Plea and Sentencing hearing held on May 22, 2017
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the charge in the information. Delivery of Meth.    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge in the information.  67 days credit . Court orders  7 yrs in the Wisconsin Prison System.  3 years confinement, 4 years extended supervision.  This sentence is concurrent to the prison sentence is is now serving.  67 days sentence credit .   Eligible for the substance abuse program Defendant must be fingerprinted and photographed at the jail for both cases. Conditions for extended supervision will be set by probation agent. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. DNA Sample to be done if not already. No Surchage.

3:30  This includes 15CF222 Defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan recomendation  - Dismiss 15CF222.  On 15CF221 Plead to  the charge.  Prison 7 yrs -  3 yrs conf and 4 yrs ES.  The court states that there has not been a preliminary hearing.  We will conduct that now.    The defendant enters a waiver of preliminary hearing. The court accepts the preliminary hearing waiver and binds the defendant over for trial
Ad Prosequendum. Original was given to the DA's office.
ad Prosequendum filed by Atty OSullivan. Original was given to the DA's office.
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: to Sheriff re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequedum. Original copy was given to the DA's office.
for prompt disposition signed by Joel Bruflodt
Plea hearing on May 22, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joel Martin Bruflodt

The Court reviews the bond conditions with the defendant. Court verifies the DOB, address and phone # with the defendant.

03:42 15CF222 also at this time for return on warrant/initial appearance. Defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt appeared by phone means, with court's permission, defendant in custody in Stanley Correctional. Prosecuting Atty Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt.  Defendant has copy of complaints.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives further reading of the complaints.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. O'Sullivan requests $20 cash bonds on each file.  Court orders $20 cash bond on 15CF221 and $20 cash bond on 15CF222. O'Sullivan addresses the court, defendant made request for prompt disposition, defendant has filed with DAs office, waiver of right to preliminary hearing, O'Sullivan will make a Writ to transport defendant. Court reviews those documents on the record with the defendant. Defendant states he has signed those forms court finds that defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives right to preliminary hearings on each case.  O'Sullivan will e-file those documents, waiver to preliminary hearing and prompt disposition. O'Sullivan requests set for status/plea hearing. Defendant has not been in the armed services.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 22, 2017 at 03:00 pm.  4:21  Court is back on the recorded on both cases.  Appearances ADA Rory OSullivan and Daniel Chapman ( by phone) the warrants are quashed on both cases by Commissioner Gavic
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on March 16, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

10:43 Defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt not in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF222 heard at this time. OSullivan requests a bench warrant on each file. Court will sign upon presentatin.
